SERTIR:​
- Brings preciousness to life.​
- Makes the sparkle endure.​
- Is the setting gesture.​

Mounting precious stones on Hermès creations is an uncompromising skill. Our artisans master several techniques, depending on the flexibility or tenacity required for every situation. Crimping allows a stone to be held firm by claws that embrace it while displaying all its beauty. A closed setting guards the stone safely within a wall. A massé setting wedges the gem in place with a gentle blow from the goldsmith’s hammer. Whatever the setting, it ensures that each gem can live a life as active as your own. ​

#KnowHow​
#Craftsmanship​
#ArtOfGestures​
#Hermes

description:
Zoom out.
An emblematic motif of Hermès since 1938, the Chaîne d’Ancre link print is a source of never-ending inspiration. For In the Loop, it becomes graphic on the leather.

Video by @ilyachemetoff and @evanrochette
Music by @tonyseng__

description:
Joyful energy. ​
About the collection: a dance in the desert, where the daylight gives way to the acid-bright shades of dusk. Colors speed by with the passing hours, coursing over agile and ethereal looks inhabited by lightness. 

About the looks: ​
1. A gilet in Thar-brown graduated perforated lambskin worn with a strap in minium-orange Swift calfskin. A bodysuit with T cutout in ebony-brown silk jacquard knit. A pair of sports trousers in Thar-brown fine treated lambskin.
2. A mixed-media dress in dawn-pink silk jersey with adjustable zipped basque and H cutout top with straps in dawn-pink silk knit.​
3. A two-piece in cinnamon-brown organzine silk jersey composed of a flag-inspired blouse with linked collar and cuffs and a high-waisted skirt with two-tone drawcord worn as braces. A pair of Lumières brutes earrings in rose gold set with spessartite garnets and their shadow in graduated spessartite garnets and rhodolite garnets.​
4. A mixed-media dress in cinnamon-brown organzine silk jersey with adjustable zipped basque and insert in sunray-inspired ribbed silk knit.​

Women’s summer 2023 runway show at the Tennis Club de Paris. Collection created by Nadège Vanhée-Cybulski. ​​
Watch the replay of the show with the link in bio.​

#Aftershow​
#SpringSummer2023​
#ParisFashionWeek​
#PFW​
#HermesFemme​
#Hermes​
caption: Photo by Hermès on October 03, 2022. May be an image of 2 people and people standing.

description:
3D in motion.
Put on your 3D glasses to fully participate in the experience.
About the collection: a dance in the desert, where the daylight gives way to the acid-bright shades of dusk. Colors speed by with the passing hours, coursing over agile and ethereal looks inhabited by lightness.

About the look: a flag-inspired cape dress in primary-red Le Rêve de Julia 3D print silk twill with linked collar and cuffs. A pair of sandals in black calfskin with sole in black carbon.

Women’s summer 2023 runway show at the Tennis Club de Paris. Collection created by Nadège Vanhée-Cybulski. 
Watch the replay of the show with the link in bio.

Flexibility in the making.
About the collection: a dance in the desert, where the daylight gives way to the acid-bright shades of dusk. Colors speed by with the passing hours, coursing over agile and ethereal looks inhabited by lightness.

About the looks:
1. A flared tiered dress in flamingo-pink silk jersey composed of three detachable parts with tie system in two-tone cord. A pair of sandals in Joey-orange suede goatskin with sole in Joey-orange carbon.
2. A wide-leg flowing jumpsuit in black silk georgette with two-tone cord fastening system on the legs. A Lumières brutes ring in rose gold set with a green tourmaline and its shadow in graduated yellow sapphires, light green sapphires and black spinels.

Women’s summer 2023 runway show at the Tennis Club de Paris. Collection created by Nadège Vanhée-Cybulski.

About the look: an overshirt in nomad-beige smooth calfskin worn with a strap in ebony-brown Swift calfskin. A short-sleeved jumper in kraft-beige hand-crocheted technical silk knit with two-tone cord lacing at the back. NOUER:​
- Brings a hidden secret into plain sight.​
- Balances manual skill with visual perfection.​
- Is the knotting gesture.​

No machine can achieve the artistry of each delicately tied knot on a Hermès creation. Adjusted by hand, with the perfect degree of control, each attachment is positioned just right thanks to the eagle-sharp eye and painstaking gesture of our special artisans. ​

#KnowHow​
#Craftsmanship​
#ArtOfGestures​
#Hermes

Hermès Factory Carré. ​
Illustrator @b_virot shares his whimsical vision of the stages that bring his iconic Hermès Factory scarf design to fruition. Firstly, the artisans in Lyon must examine how to engrave the design. Then how to color it, choosing the right shade from among the thousands of pots in the color kitchen, before moving on to the printing phase. And then: Abracadabra! At last, the scarf is ready. A cheerful comic strip adventure in our scarf factory. ​

#FantasyFactory​
#HermesFactoryCarré​
#HermesSilk​

MODELER: 
- Echoes the wearer's form.
- Translates mathematical precision into crafted fluidity. 
- Is the modeling gesture. 

Creating an accurate pattern is the starting point for every tailored Hermès garment. After listening to the customer's wishes, the tailor takes measurements, then models the construction base of the piece according to the client’s unique form, tracing the pattern on paper before cutting it, then making it in the chosen fabric. After developing this pattern, the tailor "detaches" the piece, that is, they cut the various sections of the pattern into the actual fabric, taking care to join up each line of the design. They then assemble the garment, conduct successive fittings, and make final adjustments so that the piece meets both the customer's expectations and Hermès' quality criteria. 

#KnowHow 
#Craftsmanship 
#ArtOfGestures 
#Hermes

description:
Constance and Cityslide Cross: these are the cards of the day. Discover your daily reading.👜🔮🃏​

The Constance card: Two faces, one family. You’ve turned the card of perpetuity!​ The Constance is for always, timeless and forever, to be handed on, parent to child, ​a legacy in leather.​ Named for the daughter of its creator, Constance is a classic of the collection and the first to use the iconic ‘H’ as a clasp! ​​

The Cityslide Cross card: This card represents the busy and the buzzing! You live Life with a capital ‘L’!​ Urban angels in city centres love this belt bag, reinvented. Everybody get ready to play, this sporty pouch is here to stay! A stirrup inspired buckle​​
and a strap that slides to fit, means you can wear it across your body or snug above your hip!​​

Illustration by @sophyhollington​

#TarotTwist​
#ConstanceBag​
#CityslideCrossBag​
#Hermes

Simone Hermès and Evelyne: these are the cards of the day. Discover your daily reading.👜🔮🃏​

The Simone Hermès card: The card for every heroine ​ of her own story!​ Diary in hand and head in a book?​ The Simone is the bag that suits you!​ Inspired by school books tied with ​ a strap, named for Emile Hermès’ third daughter, the Simone ​ features a clever central zipper​ and three discreet compartments.​ Perfect for those who want to be top of the class!​​

The Evelyne card: Love of companionship, a true friend at your side,​ that’s the Evelyne for you,​ a partner on your ride.​ Wear the strap across your body, and the H turned away from the world, together ​ you’re ready for anything, ​ let new adventures be unfurled! Originally designed for ​ equestrian adventures, the perforated H allowed air​ to circulate through the bag​ to dry wet accessories! ​

Illustration by @sophyhollington​

#TarotTwist​
#SimoneHermèsBag​
#EvelyneBag​
#Hermes

Haut à Courroies and Verrou: these are the cards of the day. Discover your daily reading.👜🔮🃏​
The Haut à Courroies card: Take the lead, always in charge? ​Galloping ahead? Ready for anything, and hard to forget?​ You’re matched to a bag with a belted top, buckle up, strap in and just don’t stop!​ Designed for riders to transport boots and saddles, the Haut À Courroies​ was the first bag designed ​for the house. It is as useful​ to today’s elegant traveler ​​as it ever was!​​

The Verrou card: Joy rider! Original? Sophisticated? ​​Independent? Look no further! You’ve turned the card​​ of clasp and leather! For you a clutch, a delight ​​to hold. Sensual style with a locking bolt!​ Inspired by the loose box​ and its stable door bolt, ​​this classic clutch, first cantered out of the stable​​ in 1938. Tack up and ride out! ​

Illustration by @sophyhollington​

#TarotTwist​
#HautACourroiesBag​
#VerrouBag​
#Hermes

For foodies. 🍽👜 The iconic Kelly bag combines style and structure, with a removable shoulder strap for versatility. The Kelly has been reinvented many times since its first appearance in 1930 but this is the first time it's been reimagined in cake.​

Food artist: @dimda_ ​

Kelly colors. 🎨👜 The Kelly Bicolor bag is defined by its two contrasting yet tonal colors. Created in the 1930s, The Kelly was larger than most bags of the era. Kellyado, Kellydole, Kellylakis, Kelly picnic, Kellygraphie, Kelly Danse…​

Its very own stylistic language has developed around it, with each variant further demonstrating the bag’s rich expressiveness.​

Video by @mariano_pascual​
Sound design by @s1m0nc3ll0​

#TwoTone​
#KellyBicolorBag​
#Hermes

Picotin Bicolore bag portrait. 👜👩‍🎨 With its unlined leather and understated handles, the Picotin bag has a light, youthful look. The bag is closed with a strap finished with a discreet padlock. Practical and supple, its direct style​ showcases the material with simplicity.​

Painting by @johanna_dumet ​​

#IceCreamColors​
#SunshineFlavors​
#PicotinBag​
#Hermes

description:
What’s your favorite story? 📚👜 The Béarn wallet, in homage to the region located in the South-West of France, comes from a collection bearing the names of the French regions. The Plume Mini bag comes from a featherweight line born in the 1960s, hence its name. Polishing, saddle stitching, high leather lift, metal dice on the handles: the model express all of the House's know-how. The Octogone bag’s name was chosen as a reference to the geometry of the bag. Its unique and refined construction results in an interplay of angles and roundness.​

Video by @dantezaballa​

#AStoryOfBags​
#BearnWallet​
#PlumeMiniBag​
#OctogoneBag​
#Hermes​

Slim L’Oiseau in “Love at first sight” 🐦👛😍​ The Constance Slim wallet is a clever collection of pockets and card slots to keep your daily essentials in one place. The iconic H buckle clasp completes the design. ​

Video by @elisa_valenzuelaa​

#LoveAtFirstSight​
#ConstanceSlimWallet​
#Hermes

"OH AH KOO ROO AH" 😉👜 Created in the early 20th century, The Haut à Courroies bag made life easier for riders by enabling them to transport their boots and saddle in style. With the arrival of the motor car, this trapezium-shaped model with a sculptural look was reappropriated as a travel bag.​

Video by @antoineasseraf​
Voice over @misterfonda​

#WhatsHisName​
#SoundOn​
#HautACourroiesBag​
#Hermes

Bag shaped clouds. 👜☁️ With its soft curves and rounded handles the Bolide bag was inspired by the world of the automobile in the early part of the twentieth century. The Simone Hermès bag's design takes its inspiration from the trick schoolchildren used to tie up their books with a leather belt. Named after one of Emile Hermes' four daughters, it combines three compartments – like three school books – with an adjustable leather strap. ​
 
Paintings by @florentgroc​
 
#DreamingOfBags​
#BolideBag​
#SimoneHermesBag​

"SA KA DAY PESH" 🐛💼 The Sac à Dépêches bag has been a staple of the discerning man's wardrobe since its creation in 1928. Its simple lines and elegant proportions make for effortless style and its generous interior with accordion pleat will accommodate a host of everyday essentials. Handstitched  in quality leather with the familiar signature clasp and detachable strap, carry it or wear it hands free. ​
 
Video by @antoineasseraf ​
Voice over @misterfonda​

Video by @nicolashaeni​​​

"KE-LI" 🤩👜 In 1956, when Princess Grace hugged her bag to her body in the hope of keeping her new pregnancy secret from the press, the Kelly shot to fame. Originally designed in the 1930s its trapezoid shape, cut-out flap and straps spoke of modernity and elegance. The same design beloved of Grace Kelly continues to captivate. Reinvented in multiple incarnations it remains an iconic statement for elegant women everywhere. ​
 
Video by @antoineasseraf ​
Voice over @misterfonda​
 
#KeepASecret ​
#KellyBag​
#Hermes ​

Sew magical. 🪡🧵👜 Created in 1975, the Jige clutch has kept the initials of its designer, Jean Guerrand, JG, pronounced “jijé” in French. Jean Guerrand gave this bag as a wedding present to his daughter-in-law when she married his son, Jérôme.​
 
Embroidery artist: @Ipnot​
 
#EmbroideryMagic​
#MiniBag​
#JigeClutch​
#Hermes

A thread. A story. A “Herbag en Désordre” bag. 🪡🧵👜 Created in 1998, the Herbag is an unconventional, modern and ingenious younger brother to the Kelly. Composed of raw and unstitched “spare parts”, it incorporates familiar features including the saddle nail, padlock and hanging key cover. ​
 
Video by @huwmessie​
 
#PreciseWork​
#HerbagBag​
#Hermes

Kelly Cavalcadour bag portrait. 👜👩‍🎨 In the 1930s, Robert Dumas, son-in-law of Émile Hermès, whom he succeeded at the head of Hermès (1951-1978), created the women’s bag with straps. He designed a trapezoid shape with two triangular gussets, a cutout flap, a handle and two side straps, and with it he brought the house into the era of boldness and modernism.​
 
Painting by @johanna_dumet ​
 
#ContemporaryClassic​
#KellyCavalcadourBag​
#Hermes

Oops. 🤭🥚👜 Light, with a supple hand, this Galop d’Hermès Sport bag showcases a range of contrasts with a dark body and colorful zip-pulls and loops. The Galop d’Hermès line’s signature attributes and know-how connect with a rounded shape borrowed from the iconic R.D. bag.​

Illustration by @linesbyher​

#OneEggAtATime​
#GalopdHermesSportBag​

Can you hear the cicadas? ☀️ The Kelly Picnic bag is styled here with interwoven wicker reminiscent of a traditional picnic hamper, and a leather handle, top flap and belt arms. ​​

Video by @alixbortoli​

​#VacationSpirit​

Game on! 🎮🕹️​ Discover our new Instagram filter, select your character and play with classic bags from the collection. Kelly bag, Birkin bag, Constance bag or Victoria bag: which one will you choose? ​
 
Filter and video by @manon_carrour​
 
#PickAndPlay​
#KellyBag​
#BirkinBag​
#ConstanceBag​
#VictoriaBag​
#Hermes​

Flâneur forever, Spring-Summer 2015. 👜 The simple rectangular shape of the Plume Fourre-Tout bag is inspired by a bag created in the 1920s to hold riding equipment, from horse blankets to saddle pads and stable wraps. Behind its practical zip fastening and visual simplicity, it is deceptively difficult to make. It is stitched entirely on the reverse side, then turned out like a glove.The Halzan bag was inspired by the equestrian universe with its foldover flap and the two stirrup handles. A detachable strap made for multiple carry options​. ​

Harry Gruyaert © Hermès, 2022​

#BagsInSummertime​
#PlumeBag​
#HalzanBag​
#Hermes

Sweet treat. 🍽👜 The Roulis Slim wallet is recognizable by its unique grain, obtained through boarding. This consists of rolling the leather against itself, grain against grain, to guide the grain. This can be done in a single direction to obtain fine lines or in several different directions. ​

Food artist: @dimda_ ​

#GoodEnoughToEat​
#EdibleIllusion​
#RoulisSlimWallet​
#Hermes

Straps to match. 👜🟦🟩🟫 Detachable shoulder straps make the 24/24 bag versatile for every day. It plays the card of stylistic oxymoron by oscillating between supple leather and architectural construction using the house’s signature metal clasp. ​
 
Video by @mariano_pascual​ ​
Sound design by @s1m0nc3ll0​
 
​#DayToEvening​ ​
#DetachableStrap​ ​
#2424Bag 
#Hermes​ ​ ​

Bolide bag on the move. ⚾👜 The Bolide bag is characterized by the purity of its shapes, as though it were sculpted from leather. Its two handles are inspired by the equestrian know-how of the house, which excelled in the manufacture of rolled bridles. These are more difficult to make than flat bridles but are ideal for highlighting the horse’s coat. The archetypal shape of the Bolide bag lends itself to the role of handbag or travel bag, with multiple size variants.​

Advertisement campaign Spring-Summer 2018, Bolide bag and MRTW - @jackdavisonphoto © Hermès, 2022​

#DontFall​
#BolideBag​
#Hermes

Ladies and gentlemen, please welcome “Two talking bags”, featuring the Galop d’Hermès and the Steve bags. 👜🗨️👜 Created in 1992, the Galop d'Hermès bag is reinterpreted in Harris tweed, waterproof and resistant, and in leather. With its structured line and rigid all-leather workmanship, the Steve bag, created in 2008, is a nomadic Messenger bag. ​
 
Video by @dantezaballa​
 
#BagsOnStage​
#GalopdHermesBag​
#SteveBag​
#Hermes

Bolide bag portrait. 👜👩‍🎨 The Bolide bag was created in 1923 and owes its distinctive and innovative rounded shape to the zip fastening discovered by Émile Hermès on a car hood in Canada a few years earlier. By adapting it to leather goods, he created a model simply named “sac pour auto” (“bag for motor car”), designed to slip easily into the rounded car boots of the time.​

Painting by @johanna_dumet ​

#ZipZipHurray​
#SunshineFlavors​
#BolideBag​
#Hermes

In the air (bag). 🌬️👜 The Herbag bag, or 'air bag' to borrow the French pronunciation is just that: light as air. Crafted in the supple leather, it shares familiar features with its older sibling, the Kelly, but has a more relaxed, sporty feel., with raw, unstitched components. ​

Herbag bag, “Entrez dans la danse” theme of the year, Autumn-Winter 2007 – @milesaldridge ©Hermès, 2022​

Hello you! 👜✈️👋 In 1984, during a Paris-London trip, British actress Jane Birkin, sitting next to Jean-Louis Dumas, Executive Chairman of Hermès (1978-2006), was complaining that she couldn’t find a bag suitable for her needs as a young mother. A born creator with a keen eye, he immediately sketched a supple and spacious rectangular holdall with a burnished flap and saddle stitching. With a dedicated space for baby bottles!​

Video by @elisa_valenzuelaa​

#BornInTheSky​
#BirkinBag​
#Hermes​
​

Drawing down the sun. 🎨☀️👜 Created in 1978, the Evelyne bag owes its name to its designer, the then Director of the Equestrian métier, who devised a functional bag for riders, ideal for transporting the equipment required​ for grooming horses. The perforations allowed the accessories – sponge, brush, curry comb – often placed loose and still damp in the saddlebag, to dry out. 
​
Illustrations by @olgaprader​

#SunshineChic​
#WearYourArt​
#EvelyneBag​

Who’s there? 🔦👜 The Birkin bag was designed by Jean-Louis Dumas, manager of Hermès (1978-2006) following a flight shared with Jane Birkin, from Paris to London. The actress could not find a bag to suit her needs as the mother of a young child.​ Jean-Louis Dumas immediately designed a tote bag for her, rectangular in shape, flexible and spacious, with a polished wedge and saddle stitching.​

Video by @elisa_valenzuelaa​

#BirkinInTheSpotlight​
#BirkinBag​
#Hermes​

A thread. A story. A “Haut à Courroies 40 Western” bag. 🪡🧵👜 The Haut à Courroies is the first bag of the house, designed to be worn on the saddle in a time before automobiles. Its belted top became a signature feature. 

Video by @huwmessie

#PreciseWork
#HautACourroieBag

Inside, outside. 🎨👜 The Hebdo Messenger bag is crafted in evergrain leather with a wide zipped pocket at the front and two further zipped compartments inside. For added versatility,it comes with a detachable cross-body strap. The Berline bag combines the skills of the saddler-stuffer and the saddler-stitcher, revisiting some of the Kelly’s design codes. It is characterized by its curves, which evoke the seat of a comfortable and spacious saloon car, known as a Berline in French.​

Illustrations by @pierreletanarchives 

#BagsIllustrated​
#HebdoMessengerBag​
#BerlineBag​
#Hermes​

description:
Endless road. 🛣️🔵👜 Winding through a Californian landscape, the Endless road motif was the 2018 flagship pattern of the men’s universe. The Haut à Courroies bag uses an intricate patchwork resulting from leather marquetry, where the colors of the strips blend or match each other. ​
 
Video by @thomas_harnett_omeara​
 
#NightOfAdventure​
#EndlessRoad​
#HautaCourroiesBag​
#Hermes

Bon voyage with R.M.S! 🧳🦀 This ultra-mobile case is equipped with four wheels, borrowed from Hermès skateboards designed in 2017, which glide smoothly over the ground. ​
 
Video by @teekenng​
 
#OceanGoing​
#RMSSuitcase ​
#Hermes​

Look up! Plume bag in the sky! 🔭💫👜 The Plume bag is from the first range of soft, all-leather luggage by Hermès to be so lightweight. ​ Inspired by the 1928 “blankets bag”, it was named Plume in the 1960s because its lightness was so astonishing at the time. ​As light as a Plume, or feather in French.​
 
Video by @bk_stud.io​
 
#SkyFullOfBags​
#PlumeBag​
#Hermes

Graphic details.✏️👜​ The Hermès 2002 bag is a remodelled version of a 1970s design, with its emblematic clasp featuring the signature H inscribed in its gold circle.​ The Basket Ball wallet is in soft leather with a zipped closure, practical and playful.​​
 
​​Illustrations by @henningwagenbreth​
 
#BagsIllustrated​
#Hermes2002Bag 
#BasketBallWallet​​
#Hermes​

Graphic details.✏️👜​ The Hermès 2002 bag is a remodelled version of a 1970s design, with its emblematic clasp featuring the signature H inscribed in its gold circle.​ The Basket Ball wallet is in soft leather with a zipped closure, practical and playful.​​
 
​​Illustrations by @henningwagenbreth​
 
#BagsIllustrated​
#Hermes2002Bag 
#BasketBallWallet​​

Cabas H en biais portrait. 👜👩‍🎨 The Cabas H en biais exists in two graphic versions: for the day, a jacquard canvas in contrasting pastel colors, or for its more exceptional variant, a tufted H canvas with shaved embroidery for a velvet look. ​
 
Painting by @johanna_dumet ​
 
#ThinkOrange​
#CabasHEnBiais​
#SunshineFlavors​

It's a hit.🎯👜 ​The Mosaïque au 24 Bag is a small structured box. Behind the square of refined metal and in relief, hides a clever push-button system that opens with the fingertips. ​
 
Video by @tibor_karpati​
 
#GameOn​
#MosaiqueAu24Bag​

Miniature embroidered bags and clutch. Know-Wow. 🪡🧵👜 The Trim bag is a classic referencing the curve of the horse trough with a fun fringe. The Della Cavalleria bag comes from the equestrian universe, its curves are a strong evocation of the rounded shapes of our saddles. The Médor clutch is a small clutch with a big personality. Its  clever clasp adjusts according to its content.​
 
Embroidery artist: @Ipnot​
 
#EmbroideryMagic ​
#MiniBags ​
#TrimBag ​
#DellaCavalleriaBag ​

Clever clasps. 🔒👜 The Minuit au Faubourg bag clasp uses a cylindrical system, working the same way as safe clasps. Click, clack, thwack: this is the sound of the Verrou bag clasp, inspired by the stable door bolts, used to keep the horse safely in its box. The Sac à Dépêches bag clasp is shown from the inside. Simply press the buttons and it will close without a key. No need to turn the key of the Cityhall bag clasp, just push and it will open. ​

Video by @alexis_jamet​

#KeyFeatures​​
#HermesBagsClasps​​
#Hermes

Flower pot, Shelter, Baby Bib… Style the Picotin three ways! 👜🌸🐩👶 Versatility is at the heart of the Picotin bag. Its shape, inspired by a horse's nosebag, is relaxed in supple, unlined leather. Its two handles feel soft in the hand so that you'll want to hold it. Ready to go anywhere, it will adjust to your contents without losing its hallmark shape!​
​
Illustrations by @robertsrurans​
​
#WhatsInsideYourBag​
#PicotingBag​

Have you ever seen a bag moving? 🏎️🌈 In 1923, Émile Hermès invented the Bolide bag for one of his friends, a famous manufacturer of sports cars (called “bolides” in French). It’s one of the first bags to feature a zip fastening. With its removable strap, the bag can also be worn over the shoulder.​
 
Video by @dantezaballa​

Rose pop, vert menthe, violet anémone, beige naturel… What’s your favorite “Mors de bride” color? Working as a key element, it becomes a jewel clasp with bold metallic lines, guiding the shape of the bag.​

Bolide and Hermès Geta: these are the cards of the day. Discover your daily reading. 👜🔮🃏 
 
The Bolide card: Adventure awaits! Living life in the fast lane? Always on the go? Pick up the Bolide, built to travel, built to stow, in the trunk of your fast car. Beautiful, versatile, it will go the distance. Give in to it! Take the path of least resistance! Invented for a manufacturer of sports cars back in 1923, the Bolide is the perfect road trip companion. Strap in and enjoy the journey! 
 
The Hermès Geta card: You have the world at your feet! You’re open to the fates. The Hermès Geta is the style for you, that’s what this card indicates! Wear it short, wear it long, the click of its clasp is Geta’s song. With its signature “H” clasp and base stud detail the Hermès Geta is refined, relaxed and elegant. Are you? 
 
Illustrations by @sophyhollington 
 
#TarotTwist 
#BolideBag 
#HermesGetaBag 
#Hermes

Kelly and Trim: these are the cards of the day. Discover your daily reading. 👜🔮🃏   

The Kelly card: Be more Grace! The card of the classic and elegant. Brought to fame by a royal princess, who used it to keep a secret from the press. She loved its exquisite balance and poise, for beauty lovers everywhere, it’s the perfect choice!   

The Trim card: You’ve turned the card for the sporty and the chic, the perfectly groomed and sleek! This bag to match is from an historic stable, of wide renown, of legend and fable. Its shape the shape of the manger, its clasp the bridle bit, two gussets, a zippered pocket and a strap for a perfect fit. Saddle up and ride out in classic style with the Trim!   

Illustration by @sophyhollington   

#TarotTwist  
#KellyBag  
#TrimBag

Birkin and Garden Party: these are the cards of the day. Discover your daily reading.​ 👜🔮🃏

The Birkin card: This card belongs to the goddess, strong, passionate and divine. The bag, the iconic Birkin, chic, sophisticated design. Star of her generation and famed far and wide, her external grace and elegance is matched on the inside! For lovers of timeless style with a practical edge, the Birkin wins hands down!​

The Garden Party card: Your vibe is relaxed and practical, your motto, “Take your time”. The Garden Party’s your best match: sporty, chic, sublime. Everything about you is chilled, your outlook and your vibe. This bag will hold everything you need; open it - it’s party time! Created in 2000 with traditional saddle nail press stud details, the Garden Party is the holdall that really does!​

Illustration by @sophyhollington ​

#TarotTwist​
#BirkinBag​
#GardenPartyBag​

Shadow is light's treasure. Giving form to the elusive: this is the principle behind “Les Jeux de l’ombre”, the new high jewelry collection designed by Pierre Hardy, creative director of Hermès jewelry. It relates the movement of shadow and its relationship with light, and the contrasts that connect them.

#TimeToDance​
#Hermes​

COUDRE:
- Makes leather dance.
- Marries precision tools and seasoned hands.
- Is the stitching gesture.

True to Hermès' origins as a saddler and harness maker, saddle stitching has always been used for parts that require strength and solidity such as handles, fasteners, and straps. This sewing is practised by hand using two needles. Both ends of the same beeswax-coated linen thread cross at each point through the thickness of the leather. This ensures that even if a stitch should one day break, the robust assembly will remain intact.

Video by @erik.winkowski 

#KnowHow 
#Craftsmanship 
#ArtOfGestures 
#Hermes

Lilac turns into lemonade.
A bright, vibrant summer; the joy of being together. The vacation spirit, a magic destination both joyous and serene, with the breeze imperceptibly ruffling the clothes that enfold you. A feeling of lightness makes you float in the sunlight.

2. Lemonade bucket hat in light technical satin. Hooded parka in light technical satin. Boxy polo shirt with “Tatersale remix” print. Trousers in stretch cotton serge. Sandals in neoprene canvas.

Blouson blossom.
A bright, vibrant summer; the joy of being together. The vacation spirit, a magic destination both joyous and serene, with the breeze imperceptibly ruffling the clothes that enfold you. A feeling of lightness makes you float in the sunlight. 

About the looks:
1. Stone zipped straight blouson in “Herbier” perforated sporty calfskin. Tank top in compact cotton poplin. “Alpha Kelly” 
necklace in silver. 
2. Double-breasted jacket in crispy technical piqué. Tank top in compact cotton poplin. 

Men’s summer 2023 runway show at the Manufacture des Gobelins. Collection created by Véronique Nichanian, show directed by Cyril Teste. 
Watch the replay of the show with the link in bio. 

#LiveShow 
#Summer2023

#PFW

Light as summer. ​
A bright, vibrant summer; the joy of being together. The vacation spirit, a magic destination both joyous and serene, with the breeze imperceptibly ruffling the clothes that enfold you. A feeling of lightness makes you float in the sunlight. ​

About the looks: ​
1. Lemonade hooded parka in light technical satin. Boxy polo shirt with “Tatersale remix” print. Trousers in stretch cotton serge.​
2. Shirt-jacket in two-tone braided cotton voile. Tank top in “Berlingot” canvas. Bermuda shorts in stretch cotton serge.​

Men’s summer 2023 runway show at the Manufacture des Gobelins. Collection created by Véronique Nichanian, show directed by Cyril Teste.​​

description:
Summer on canvas. 
A bright, vibrant summer; the joy of being together. The vacation spirit, a magic destination both joyous and serene, with the breeze imperceptibly ruffling the clothes that enfold you. A feeling of lightness makes you float in the sunlight. 

About the looks: 
1. Over-shirt in natural crepe serge with “Icônes au carré” crests. Bermuda shorts with drawstring waist in technical panama canvas. 
2. Short-sleeve shirt in plume nubuck calfskin. Trousers in stretch cotton serge. “Haut à courroies” bag with distorted checks.
3. Hooded sweatshirt in two-tone braided cotton voile. Trousers in stretch cotton serge. Sandals in neoprene.

Men’s summer 2023 runway show at the Manufacture des Gobelins. Collection created by Véronique Nichanian, show directed by Cyril Teste.

ASTIQUER:​
- Sublimates leather.​
- Lavishes attention on often forgotten details.​
- Is the polishing gesture.​

Even the smallest detail deserves respect. Our artisans sand, stain, smooth, polish, and rub the edge of the leather. The process is very time-consuming, taking up to several hours for a bag. ​

Video by @erik.winkowski​​​

#KnowHow​​​
#Craftsmanship​​​
#ArtOfGestures​​​
#Hermes

Cultivate your new style of garden.​
The Petit h garden in the Sèvres store is a funny, unusual and surprising garden. A ballad where Petit h objects are cultivated from Hermès materials that are no longer used and reinterpreted thanks to the talents of passionate artists and craftsmen. A fantastic garden born from the line of @serge.bloch, which will grow at the Sèvres store, in Paris, until September 10, 2022.​

#PetitH​
#Garden​
#Hermes

Will you find it? ​
Echoing the classic newsstand kiosks of Paris, a new kiosk welcomes you into the Monde d'Hermès universe. Rendez-vous in Rotterdam, 16-19 June. Come for the joyful ambience, magic tricks or even a surprise concert... leave with a copy of le Monde d'Hermès and a fresh bouquet.​

Woven light.​
For the first time, textiles have become the central theme of a home collection. They express lightness with a collection of blankets whose designs are the starting point for exploring new know-how. Five cashmere creations form the basis of this manifesto for lightness. H Pythagore plays with the assembly of hand-woven and hand-dyed colored squares. ​

To be discovered from 8 to 12 June at La Pelota, Via Palermo, 10 - Milan Design Week.​

#MilanDesignWeek​
#HermesHome​
#Hermes

Lightness by design.​
For the first time, textiles have become the central theme of a home collection. They express lightness with a collection of blankets whose designs are the starting point for exploring new know-how. Five cashmere creations form the basis of this manifesto for lightness. With its colored panels assembled by linking, the Construction blanket resembles a stained-glass window in textile.​

To be discovered from 8 to 12 June at La Pelota, Via Palermo, 10 - Milan Design Week.​

#MilanDesignWeek​
#HermesHome​
#Hermes

Know-how united.​
For the first time, textiles have become the central theme of a home collection. They express lightness with a collection of blankets whose designs are the starting point for exploring new know-how. Five cashmere creations form the basis of this manifesto for lightness. The Surface bedspread features surprising hexagons crafted in cashmere and combines the meticulous techniques of patchwork and quilting.​

To be discovered from 8 to 12 June at La Pelota, Via Palermo, 10 - Milan Design Week.​

#MilanDesignWeek​
#HermesHome​
#Hermes​

Lightness of lines. ​
The objects, porcelain, and furniture assert their uniqueness. A sheet of leather, cut, folded and hand-painted, becomes a table centerpiece; porcelain plates reflect the sun’s rays, and a canework seat makes a chair as graceful as it is robust. ​Find the right balance between material and color. Seek lightness in the design of the object. Capture the essence of the material and enrich it with the work of an innovative hand. ​

To be discovered from 8 to 12 June at La Pelota, Via Palermo, 10 - Milan Design Week.​

#MilanDesignWeek​
#HermesHome​
#Hermes

Play of lights. ​
The quest for lightness, as a challenge to gravity, is expressed in the creation of objects for the home staged in four structures. These forms, resembling water towers, are vast but still light. Made of wood and covered with translucent colored paper, they radiate light. Inside, each object expresses an area of know-how whose power lies in its precision. Perception of the creations changes as light plays over them when they are backlit against the structures, each a poetic colossus and a point of anchor for these little miracles of balance.​
 
To be discovered from 8 to 12 June at La Pelota, Via Palermo, 10 - Milan Design Week.​
 
#MilanDesignWeek​
#HermesHome​
#Hermes

The quest for lightness, as a challenge to gravity, is expressed in the creation of objects for the home staged in four structures. These forms, resembling water towers, are vast but still light. Made of wood and covered with translucent colored paper, they radiate light. Inside, each object expresses an area of know-how whose power lies in its precision. Perception of the creations changes as light plays over them when they are backlit against the structures, each a poetic colossus and a point of anchor for these little miracles of balance.​
 
To be discovered from 8 to 12 June at La Pelota, Via Palermo, 10 - Milan Design Week.​
 
#MilanDesignWeek​
#HermesHome​
#Hermes

Taking form.​
Hermès will be taking part in Milan Design Week from June 8 to 12. The collections for the home will be staged in a set composed of four vast and airy structures that radiate light. Textiles will be in the spotlight, driven by new know-how.​

#MilanDesignWeek​

Time to share. 
Echoing the classic newsstand kiosks of Paris, a new kiosk welcomes you into the Monde d'Hermès universe. From its first appearance in Prague in 2021, it now calls you for a new experience in Knokke-le-Zoute, 3-6 June. Come for the carefree games, joyful ambience, even a surprise concert... and leave with a copy of le Monde d'Hermès.

Time as an ally.
The house’s creations are of their time, but they have no planned obsolescence: Hermès objects are designed to last, to be repaired and passed on.
 
Meet the artisans behind Hermès’ sustainable craftsmanship until the 29th May 2022 at Hermès In The Making, OGR Torino.

description:
The culture of craftsmanship. ​
Since the creation of Hermès in 1837, the six generations of craftsmen who have succeeded each other in the workshops have preserved and nurtured their know-how. The repertoire of craftsmanship skills is vibrant and continually growing.​
 
Meet the artisans behind Hermès’ sustainable craftsmanship until the 29th May 2022 at Hermès In The Making, OGR Torino.​

Infinite ride. ​
🐎​

Two iconic Hermès symbols -- the horse and the orange box -- unite in this animation by artist @geoffroy_de_crecy​

#MusicBox​
#OrangeBox​
#Hermes​

​

PERLER:​
- Adds refinement to robustness.​
- Embodies an ancient skill.​
- Is the pearling gesture.​

Under the artful blows of our artisan's hammer, the humble nail becomes a voluptuous jewel. This pure crimping operation, called pearling, consists of giving the cut tip the same curved, pearl-shaped appearance as its head. Thus made soft to the touch, the pearled nail is a distinctive sign of Hermès craftsmanship. ​

​Video by @erik.winkowski​​​

#KnowHow​​​
#Craftsmanship​​​
#ArtOfGestures​​​
#Hermes​

PLIER: ​​
- Breathes magic into silk.​​
- Guards the secrets of a precious technique.​​
- Is the folding gesture.​​

​Whatever the design, a tie consists of two sides, one big and one small, joined together and aligned. To give it a more durable hold, an interlining is added inside. According to a method specific to Hermès, the tie is closed. The particular folding method applied ensures exceptional volume in its appearance. ​​

​Video by @erik.winkowski​​

#KnowHow​​
#Craftsmanship​​

Equestrian ballet. 
🐴

Join us for the 12th edition of the Saut Hermès 2022, 18–20 March at the Grand Palais Éphémère at sauthermes.com.

Reserved for the best riders in the world and the youngest riders under the age of 25, the Saut Hermès is also a place to meet others from the horse world, with a series of unique experiences.

description:
They're jumping! Now at the Grand Palais Ephémère, Paris.

COUPER:​
- Comes from a long line of tradition.​
- Propels fabric into new dimensions. ​
- Is the cutting gesture.​

​After creating the pattern for a garment, the tailor “detaches” it by cutting the various parts of the pattern from the fabric, taking care to connect each line of the design. They then assemble the garment, conduct fitting sessions, and make the final adjustments, so that the piece satisfies the customer’s expectations and Hermès’ quality standards. ​

Video by @erik.winkowski​

#KnowHow​
#Craftsmanship​
#ArtOfGestures​

CUISINER:
- Makes the silk sing.
- Is a question of precision.
- Is the gesture behind the colors of the silk.

To make colors according to recipes prescribed by our colorists, the artisans still largely work by hand. They use pots, blenders and precision scales (with everything measured out to the nearest milligram) to "cook up" mixtures of pigments and vegetable gums that simmer on stoves. And rather like a good sauce, we control everything to achieve the right viscosity and color. 

Video by @erik.winkowski

#KnowHow
#Craftsmanship
#ArtOfGestures
#Hermes

Surprises at every turn.​
 
Optimism, lightness. This collection expresses a heartfelt desire for oxymorons and sophistication, contrasting materials, and superimposed elements tumbling after each other.​
 
About the looks: Straight suit in plain wool flannel with leather insert, Chaîne d’Ancre badge, Éperon d’Or fringed 65 cm carré in cashmere and silk, and a Kelly Dépêches 25 Colormatic Touch bag in Barenia ebony calf. Aviator blouson in colored sheepskin with a twisted collar, a bucket hat in water-repellent technical satin. Turtleneck pullover in cable knit wool and cashmere with playful contrasted stripes and straight pleated trousers in water-repellent compact cotton serge. ​
 
Men’s winter 2022 runway show at the @mobiliernational. Collection created by Véronique Nichanian, show directed by Cyril Teste.​
Watch the show with the link in bio. ​
 
#LiveShow​
#Winter2022​
#ParisFashionWeek​
#PFW​
#HermesHomme​

Dream in style.

Creation at petit h works in reverse, since the starting point is not a preconceived idea, but materials for which the other métiers have no further use, and with which artisans, artists and designers improvise while combining them in a thousand and one different ways. 
Petit h creates a playful dialogue around sustainability and reinvention, limited edition objects and the reuse of materials. 

#SweetDreams

Years of training are required to master the intricate manual skills underpinning each métier. Repair and restoration are a matter of experience, but also demand ingenuity, creativity and determination. 

Durability is at the core of the creative process at Hermès, whose objects are designed to increase in beauty and acquire a patina over time, as also to be handed down.

Meet the artisans behind Hermès’ sustainable craftsmanship until the 24th October 2021 at Hermès In The Making, Danish Architecture Center in Copenhagen.

#TimeOurAlly
#KellyBag
#KnowHow
#Durability
#HermesInTheMaking
#Hermes

Each year, more than 100,000 Hermès objects are brought to our stores by their owners for repair or restoration.
 
Durability is at the core of the creative process at Hermès, whose objects are designed to increase in beauty and acquire a patina over time, as also to be handed down.
 
Video extracted from the film on Hermès’ repair workshop in Hong Kong, China, by Frédéric Laffont, ©Hermès, Paris, 2019. Collection “Footsteps across the world”.
 
Meet the artisans behind Hermès’ sustainable craftsmanship until the 24th October 2021 at Hermès In The Making, Danish Architecture Center in Copenhagen.
 
#TimeOurAlly
#KellyBag
#KnowHow
#Durability
#HermesInTheMaking
#Hermes

Our leather repair experts have all the expertise of our saddlers and leather workers. They tend to our customers’ objects with great care, whether to give them a little spruce-up or to completely repair or restore parts that may have undergone wear and tear over time. 
 
Durability is at the core of the creative process at Hermès, whose objects are designed to increase in beauty and acquire a patina over time, as also to be handed down.

The glove-makers use a traditional technique that takes its name from a 19th-century glove-maker from Grenoble, France, called Jouvin. He invented the “iron-hand” shape-cutter which is used to cut out the exact shape for each finger.
 
Over the past three decades, Hermès has expanded throughout France by setting up several production sites and workshops in regions that nurture a long history of specific savoir-faire.
 
Meet the artisans behind Hermès’ sustainable craftsmanship until the 24th October 2021 at Hermès In The Making, Danish Architecture Center in Copenhagen.
 
#TheTalentOfOurRegions
#KnowHow

The Hermès Ganterie de Saint-Junien, in the heart of the Limousin region, is a certified “Entreprise du patrimoine vivant,” a label used to designate a Living Heritage Company in France and reserved for exceptional techniques with long-standing geographic roots found in certain territories. The tradition of glove-making traces its roots to the Middle Ages in this region. 

Over the past three decades, Hermès has expanded throughout France by setting up several production sites and workshops in regions that nurture a long history of specific savoir-faire.

Meet the artisans behind Hermès’ sustainable craftsmanship until the 24th October 2021 at Hermès In The Making, Danish Architecture Center in Copenhagen.

#TheTalentOfOurRegions

Porcelain painting is the art of transferring by hand a design or pattern onto exceptional pieces of different sizes and shapes. With remarkable dexterity, the porcelain artisan must use their powers of composition to render the original design as faithfully as possible. 

Exceptional materials are exalted by Hermès artisans. 

Meet the artisans behind Hermès’ sustainable craftsmanship until the 24th October 2021 at Hermès In The Making, Danish Architecture Center in Copenhagen.

#KnowHow
#HighQualityMaterials
#FauvesDeNuit
#HermesInTheMaking
#Hermes

The whiteness of porcelain is down to the presence of kaolin in the paste. Since the 18th century, porcelain has been produced in France thanks to the discovery of kaolin deposits in Saint-Yrieix-la-Perche near Limoges. ​
​
Exceptional materials are exalted by Hermès artisans. ​
​
Meet the artisans behind Hermès’ sustainable craftsmanship until the 24th October 2021 at Hermès In The Making, Danish Architecture Center in Copenhagen.​
​
#KnowHow​
#HighQualityMaterials​
#HermesInTheMaking​
#Hermes​

​
Exceptional materials are exalted by Hermès artisans. ​

The artisan supervises the process at the carré printing table, which is 150 meters in length. The color is poured by hand with control, following a pre-determined order, and the speed of printing is carefully calibrated.
 
Since its founding in 1837, six generations of artisans have safeguarded and nurtured their ancestral know-how in the Hermès workshops. 
 
Meet the artisans behind Hermès’ sustainable craftsmanship until the 24th October 2021 at Hermès In The Making, Danish Architecture Center in Copenhagen.

#KnowHow
#DansePacifiqueCarré
#HermesInTheMaking
#Hermes

At Hermès, the carré is made using the “Lyon” silk screen printing process, named after the geographical region where this flatbed screen technique was perfected. This traditional technique consists of successively printing each color that constitutes the design of a carré, in a precise order.

Since its founding in 1837, six generations of artisans have safeguarded and nurtured their ancestral know-how in the Hermès workshops. 

Meet the artisans behind Hermès’ sustainable craftsmanship until the 24th October 2021 at Hermès In The Making, Danish Architecture Center in Copenhagen.

caption: Photo by Hermès in Hermès.

description:
Harmonious balance.​ ​

Sillage d’Hermès armchair is an organically shaped, generously proportioned seat with distant origins, designed by Studio Mumbai. With a wooden frame, it is encased in an unprecedented blend made from cellulose microfibres. Striking a harmonious balance between innovative materials and age-old know-how, this robust and sensual totemic chair is hand-varnished and hand-painted, line after line, offering an intimate relationship with the material.​ To be discovered from 5 to 10 September at La Pelota, Via Palermo, 10 - Milan Design Week.​ ​

#Craftsmanship​
#MilanDesignWeek​
#HermesHome ​
#Hermes

Organic curves.​ ​

From 5 to 10 September, Hermès presents its new collections for the home at Milan Design Week. Colors, materials and know-how are expressed in a scenography offering remarkable graphic perspectives and sound design.​ ​

#HermesHome ​
#Hermes

Conversation starters.​ ​

The Sialk table centrepieces, crafted from copper foil and colored with stencilled enamels, are a real technical achievement. Several applications and firings are needed to create these unique pieces, which express a rich array of textures and contrasts after firing in a subtle balance between fused pigments and the rawness of the materials. ​ To be discovered from 5 to 10 September at La Pelota, Via Palermo, 10 - Milan Design Week.​ ​

#Craftsmanship​
#MilanDesignWeek​
#HermesHome ​
#Hermes

Solid design.​

Oscillating between tradition and innovation, know-how is a fundamental part of the creative process. Pushing back their limits and reinventing unique know-how by working with leather, textiles, copper and stone, while ensuring precise lines: the inquisitive soul of the artisan dreams of useful objects that transcend time. The new collections embrace the simplicity of an elegance that gives way to refinement and comfort.​
To be discovered from 5 to 10 September at La Pelota, Via Palermo, 10 - Milan Design Week.​

#StoneTable​
#MilanDesignWeek ​
#HermesHome ​
#Hermes

Silk run under the sun.
 
The Brides de Gala giant carré is a slice of summer to lift you whatever the weather. Wrap yourself in silk and take a late summer flight!
🌞
 
#SilkSunshine
#SummerOfSilk
#BridesDeGalaCarré
#HermesSilk
#Hermes
 
Photograph by Harry Gruyaert / @magnumphotos
 
The Story Behind "Brides de Gala": Created by Hugo Grygkar in 1957, the Brides de Gala scarf needs no introduction. Its numerous reinterpretations – Fleuries, Love, Bayadère, Shadow, Finesse and many others – exemplify the timelessness of the original design that has continued to embody the elegance of Hermès for over six decades. Two ceremonial bridles from the second half of the 19th century face one another.

Clip clop, tip top!​
​
Our pony turns up the audio guide to hear about a crazy horse ride. The joyful Cheval de Fête shawl provides the entertainment in this playful picture by @rozchast ​
🐴​
​
#ArtofSilk​
#PrivateViewing​
#ChevalDeFêteShawl ​
#HermesSilk​
#Hermes​
​
The story behind "Cheval de Fête"​: This design by Jan Bajtlik joyfully pays tribute to the posters of the Polish School from the 1950s to the 1970s. The artists of Warsaw broke with the era’s conventions to illustrate films, plays, concerts and exhibitions. More than just a question of drawing the eye, they sought to harness the art of detail through the use of simple lines and emblematic figures. Rosettes, ribbons and geometric patterns recall the power of these creations. The mischievous face of Kluska, the designer’s dog, makes an appearance on the right of the composition.​

Cool Cats.​

@rozchast gallery visitor admires a distant relative as depicted in the Acinonyx Jubatus carré wash. ​
🐱🐱​
​
#ArtofSilk​
#PrivateViewing​
#AcinonyxJubatausCarréWash​
#HermesSilk​
#Hermes​
​
The Story Behind "Acinonyx Jubatus": Particularly common in southern Africa, the cheetah or Acinonyx Jubatus, with his noble bearing and physical prowess, is a fascinating creature. From his vantage point, he gazes into the distance. No movement in the savannah escapes his notice, not even the smallest quiver in the grass. His extreme suppleness allows him to run at more than sixty miles per hour over short distances to capture his prey. French animal artist Robert Dallet, who passed away in 2006, was one of the house’s emblematic collaborators, and his work continues to be brought to life to this day.​

Watch the birdie. ​
 
Feathered visitors flock to the gallery where @rozchast has installed the Toucan de Paradis carré. ​

​
#ArtofSilk​
#PrivateViewing​
#ToucanDeParadisCarré​
#HermesSilk​
#Hermes​
​
The story behind "Toucan de Paradis"​
The toucan, a climbing bird characteristic of tropical forests, is particularly prevalent in the Amazon. Here, illustrator Katie Scott, who is passionate about biology and renowned for her botanical and animal plates, presents an imaginary species. The birds chirp proudly – no doubt heralding a song that will make them the kings of the woods! Their decorative plumage, characteristic of the bird-of-paradise and the peacock, underlines their rarity and the exotic inspiration of their designer. These elements combine to form a marvelous painting tinged with naturalism.

Building blocks and building knots. ​ ​
 
Artist @philipwiegard assembles details from the Entrelacé carré using fimo modelling clay. Watch as patterns inspired by antique bridles and harnesses from the carré emerge! ​

#SilkKnots​
#EntrelacéCarré​
#HermesSilk​
#Hermes​ ​

 If I Was Your Lover by Marshall Vincent @marshallvincent.flac 

The story behind "Entrelacé": The Émile Hermès collection houses a copy of the German riding treatise Della Cavalleria, published in Bavaria in 1609. The richly illustrated book has inspired several designers of scarfs, and the Anamorphée artist collective has also immersed itself in this prestigious book. A selection of antique bridles and harnesses is combined with the six letters of Hermès, enhanced by a perspective effect. The ensemble forms a picture that looks like an elegant alphabet book.​

The Masan Masan carré is the basis of  this animation by @matmaitland, combining elements which inspired the design. Horses, birds, zebras and flowers are the ingredients. It’s ‘surreally’ good! ​
🐴🐴​ ​
 
#SilkSurreal​
#SilkSoReal​
#MasanMasanCarré​
#HermesSilk​
#Hermes​ ​
 
The Story Behind "Masan Masan": In Thailand where they flourish, water hyacinths are collected, then dried in the sun before being woven. They are used for basketry to create various objects such as baskets, hats, sandals and animal-shaped toys. The Masan, which means "woven horse" in Thai, is one of them. The designer Terawat Teankaprasith, who was one of the six winners of the Grand Prix du Carré Hermès launched in 2019, took inspiration from this ancestral expertise to create a striking and majestic piece.​

A blur, a smudge, a comic book,
Turn the page and take a look!
Action on both sides, Kapow!
Two schemes, two images, Double Face Wow!
💥

#DoubleFaceWowCarré​
#SilkStory​
#HermesSilk​
#Hermes​

Photograph by @jamie.hawkesworth​ 

The Story Behind “Double Face Wow”: Young French artist @ugobienvenu is the creator of a series of short, animated films produced for the house, featuring the Hermès woman. He used them as inspiration for this appealing silk comic strip full of humor. The heroine travels across Paris in a sports car, on horseback, on rollerblades and by jet-ski. As she flies past, feisty and fearless in all circumstances, she is spotted by two golfers. “An Amazon?” they wonder. “No, the Hermès woman!” Presented on a double-sided scarf, the design plays on translation and color, offering a multicolored French version on one side and a monochrome English version on the other.

description:
A mythical mash-up.

This playful collage by @matmaitland teases us with images from antiquity which feature on the La Danse des Amazones shawl. ​
🦁 🐯​

#MythicalModernity​
#LaDanseDesAmazonesShawl​
#HermesSilk​
#Hermes​

The Story Behind "La Danse des Amazones": The Franco-German artist Édouard Baribeaud likes to combine mythical events with present moments. Here, a young woman half-concealed by a screen appears almost like an extension of its painted procession of amazons. In this composite interior, where antique mosaics feature alongside modern furniture, she seems to be preparing for a dinner or celebration. The scene abounds with contemporary and symbolic elements, such as a vinyl record that conveys the party atmosphere. Displayed in medallions around the edges of the design are emblems such as the owl, an allegory of wisdom, and the pomegranate, the fruit symbolic of fertility and knowledge.​

description:
Leopards in the living room!
 
Work hard, play harder! @matmaitland playful collage of Les 12 Léopards shawl shows us working from home can be wild... It’s a jungle out there!
🐆
 
#JungleLife
#Les12LéopardsShawl
#HermesSilk
#Hermes
 
The Story Behind "Les 12 Léopards": Twelve leopards laze around, half hidden by the foliage or slumbering in the center of a strange open-air workroom. All of them? No! One of them has put on a pair of glasses and is enjoying the contents of a mysterious book, while another is exploring scrolls in a box. The Korean artist Jin Kwon creates a dream in the spirit of the folding screens of her country, at the heart of a jungle where sophistication and curiosity abound. The abundance of vegetation is matched by the countless knick-knacks, pots and notebooks in the colors of Hermès: a fascinating disarray that is fitting for any collector.

Photograph by @davidleyes​ ​ ​ ​ 

The Story Behind "Grand Théâtre Nouveau": The Épinal imagery was founded in Vosges, France in 1796. For two centuries, this printing house distributed colored images throughout Europe, illustrating countless subjects: exotic fauna and flora, common trades, historical events, fables and legends, riddles, etc. Gianpaolo Pagni had the privilege of accessing the archives of this house and exploring its secrets. Inspired by the ancient engravings he discovered there, he composed this surprising theater scene that features wild animals as the protagonists. An ingenious combination of geometric patterns that evokes the characteristic work of his drawings created with stamps.

A big stage for a tiny box.​ ​ 
​
Created by miniaturist @phillipnuveen, his small scale version of our iconic box contains the mini Grand Théâtre Nouveau carré. With wild animals in the leading roles, it’s a real show stopper! ​ ​ 
🎭 ​ ​ ​ ​ 

#MiniatureCarré
#GrandThéâtreNouveauCarré

description:
All in good hands.
 
This fun sized Hermès experience is the creation of miniaturist @phillipnuveen. His teeny-tiny reproduction of the iconic Hermès box contains a pocket size gem: a mini Dress Code Double Face carré! This scarf is a truly unique gallery of portraits. Which one is your favourite?
🖐️🟧
 
#DressCodeDoubleFaceCarré
#MiniatureCarré
#HermesSilk
#Hermes
 
Photograph by @davidleyes
 
The Story Behind “Double Face Dress Code”: A truly unique gallery of portraits! Historical, mythical and totally unusual characters feature in this game of posing for an invisible photographer – Marie-Antoinette, Fantomas and the winged-hat god are all dazzled by the camera. American illustrator Daniel Clowes, an author of graphic novels inspired by 1950s comics, playfully mixes genres and eras, while also evoking the wild atmosphere of masquerade balls in the early 20th century. "Who am I?", the pretty woman seems to ask in the center. With flawless hair and a domino mask concealing her eyes, she is the real heroine of this double-sided scarf.

description:
It’s unbe-leaf-able!

Using vegetables, artist @bdenzer recreates the En Roue Libre carré. Let’s ‘kale’ it art you can eat!
🥕

#EdibleArt
#EnRoueLibreCarré

#HermesSilk
#Hermes

The Story Behind “En Roue Libre”: The collar was a piece of equestrian equipment placed around the neck of harnessed horses in former times to allow the coachman to guide them. In this design, its distinctive oval shape encircles models of horse-drawn carriages from the 19th century. The manufacture of these light vehicles involved numerous craftsmen, the most important of whom was undoubtedly the wheelwright, who specialized in shaping and hooping the wheels. Harnesses and buckles recall this bygone era which was disrupted in the 1890s by the invention of the motor car. This scarf from 1978 is available in new colors this season.

#HermesSilk ​
#Hermes ​ ​
 
The story behind "Voitures Exquises": located in Poland, in the city of the same name, Łancut castle has one of the most beautiful collections of horse-drawn carriages in Europe. Some of these carriages' harnesses were produced by the house of Hermes, which maintains close relations with the museum. Like many Poles, Jan Bajtlik has visited the castle many times since childhood. Having chosen twenty horse-drawn vehicles, the artist had fun cutting them in two and mixing up the halves as he pleased, like a game of exquisite corpse – or, in this case, exquisite carriages! Simply fold the scarf to join up the correct halves and reassemble the original vehicles.​

description:
Can you silk me?​

Let me introduce myself. I am a silk cashmere carré knotted with nonchalance and decontracted elegance. I believe that effortlessness is the new cool. I am inspired by big city metro lines, my pocket square has the letters H E R M E S hidden somewhere. The stations have been transformed into the links of the Chaine d'Ancre, a subtle reference to the iconic motif of Hermès. Voilà!​
